Job Posting: 178366 - Position: S26 Risk Specialist Intern 178366 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 02/28/2026 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 02/17/2026 12:27 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Interac Corp. Suite 2400 - 200 Bay Street Toronto M5J 2J1 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description Who We Are: 2026 - Summer S26 Risk Specialist Intern 178366 Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List $21 to $23 Every transaction matters. Every Canadian matters. At Interac, we protect both - driving trust, security, and inclusion, so our digital economy thrives. Founded in 1984, Interac connects Canadians through secure digital payments, advanced identity verification and industry-leading fraud protection. Connecting banks, businesses, and individuals, Interac enables millions to send, receive, and manage money safely and effortlessly every day - across both digital and physical environments. As the backbone of Canada's financial ecosystem, Interac facilitates over 20 million transactions daily, supported by trusted partnerships with government and financial institutions. Consistently ranked as Canada's most reputable financial technology brand, Interac is deeply embedded in the daily lives of Canadians. Who You Will Work With: This is not your typical risk management internship. We are looking for a data-savvy, design-minded intern to help us reimagine how risk is communicated and operationalized across the business. You'll work at the intersection of engineering, analytics, and business design, helping us build the next generation of risk dashboards, reporting systems, and workflow tools. You'll collaborate directly with senior leaders and cross-functional teams to bring clarity, structure, and insight to complex risk data, turning it into something people actually want to use What You Will Do: • Design and build dashboards that bring risk data to life-enabling smarter, faster decisions across the organization. • Prototype and iterate on reporting templates and visualizations using tools like Power BI or Tableau. • Map and streamline workflows to clarify ownership and show how risk moves through the business. • Document and improve processes that support accountability, transparency, and operational resilience. • Collaborate across teams, including business lines, corporate functions, product, technology, data, and compliance to understand risk reporting needs and elevate them into integrated, scalable systems. • Support the evolution of enterprise risk reporting tools, helping to modernize how risk is visualized, communicated, and embedded across the organization. Job Requirements What You Bring: • Your currently pursuing an undergraduate degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business, or a related field at a recognized Canadian institution. • You have a strong analytical mindset and can translate complex data into clear, actionable insights. • You're fluent in Microsoft 365 (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook) and comfortable navigating shared platforms like SharePoint and Teams. • You have hands-on experience with business intelligence tools like Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms. • You bring attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and a willingness to work through ambiguity. • You're comfortable working independently and collaboratively, managing multiple priorities with confidence and focus. • You're curious about how organizations manage risk and how data, design, and systems thinking can make it better. • You're confident engaging with stakeholders and understanding how their work connects to broader business processes. • You're disciplined, organized, and thrive in environments where deadlines and quality both matter • You bring attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and a willingness to work through ambiguity • You're disciplined, organized, and thrive in environments where deadlines and quality both matter. • You build trust easily and enjoy working with people across different teams and levels • Although not required, you have some familiarity or previous experience with the following: An engineering background or experience with risk, compliance, or process design is a plus-but not essential. • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: https://interac.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Interac/job/Toronto/Risk-Specialist-Intern_REQ-2096?q=intern Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
